column2: WASHINGTON DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Washington
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Get enough sleep.

column2: 2. In heavy rain, tires can ride on a thin film of water, without touching the road. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.
column6: risk-planning
column8: hydroplaning.

column2: 3. If you’re going to turn left onto a one-way street, complete the turn into:
column4: the lane closest to the one you came from.
column6: either lane.
column8: the right lane.

column2: 4. If you drive a motor vehicle registered in Washington State, you must:
column4: carry insurance only if you ride a motorcycle or a vehicle requiring a CDL license.
column6: have liability insurance.
column8: carry insurance only if you’re under the age of 18.
column10: carry insurance only if your vehicle is newer than 5 years.

column2: 5. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: look and listen for trains.

column2: 6. If a bicyclist on the road ahead has their left arm extended downward to their left, you should assume the bicyclist is signaling that he/she is:
column4: tired.
column6: about to turn right.
column8: turning left.

column2: 7. When passing another vehicle on a road with 2 lanes traveling in opposite directions:
column4: do not return to the right side of the road until when you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: drive in either lane.
column8: return to the right side of the road immediately.
column10: when you return to the driving lane, try to leave as little room as possible between you and the vehicle you have passed.

column2: 8. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: On the right curb.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 9. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, except for school zones.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 10. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 11. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: Marijuana.
column6: A cold remedy.
column8: Tranquilizers.

column2: 12. When the traffic light is green, to make a left turn you should:
column4: wait for the red light and make a turn on red.
column6: yield to oncoming traffic and turn when safe to do so.
column8: signal other drivers to stop so you can turn.
column10: wait for another driver to signal that it's your turn.

column2: 13. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column10: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 14. To reduce the risk of being involved in a crash, drivers should:
column4: ignore other drivers on the road.
column6: avoid driving during rush hour.
column8: communicate with other drivers on the road.
column10: drive on side streets and back roads whenever possible.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: No parking on pavement.
column8: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there's an intersection ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 17. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 18. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 19. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 20. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column8: Motorcycles are hard to see.

column2: 21. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in a tunnel.
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: in a crosswalk.

column2: 22. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the stop line.
column6: Before the crosswalk.
column8: On the crosswalk.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Do not turn right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 24. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 25. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 26. On a roadway with 3 or more lanes, you must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights:
column4: if you’re traveling in the opposite direction as the bus.
column6: Always.
column8: only if you're in front of a school and children are crossing the road.
column10: only if you’re traveling in the same direction as the bus.

column2: 27. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: turn left into the one-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 28. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: high beam headlights.
column6: emergency flashers.
column8: low beam headlights.

column2: 29. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: always stop.
column6: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column2: 30. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column6: a steep grade is ahead.
column8: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column10: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.

column2: 31. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column10: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.

column2: 32. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Reduced speed.
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.
column8: Driving within the range.

column2: 33. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column6: the road may be slippery when wet.
column8: narrow road ahead.

column2: 34. The driver in the picture is about to:
column4: pass another vehicle.
column6: turn right.
column8: turn left.

column2: 35. This signal means:
column4: Proceed
column6: Slow down
column8: Stop

column2: 36. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column6: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: Warning: sharp left turn ahead.
column6: You may make a U-turn.
column8: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 39. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: of a reduction of lanes
column6: that a reversible lane starts.
column8: that a divided highway ends

column2: 40. If you must drive during ice or snow storms, you should:
column4: All the other answers are correct.
column6: clear the ice and snow from your vehicle.
column8: make sure the windshield washer reservoir is filled with a cleaning solution that resists freezing.
